Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Pfizer vaccine does not cause birth defects through genetic manipulation.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential risks of the Pfizer vaccine by falsely stating that it may cause birth defects.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by misinterpreting the information from page 132 of the Pfizer vaccine study and misrepresenting its recommendations.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or mention of birth defects or genetic manipulation resulting from the vaccine.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the Pfizer vaccine can cause birth defects through genetic manipulation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may be influenced by viral false claims that COVID-19 vaccines alter or damage human DNA.
